i wanna be like u one day :)
Thank you so much, Errichto, for your efforts in making all these videos/streams. I like them a lot and learn so much from peeking your ways to solve problems.
Can you please make a video on advanced DP techniques like Convex Hull Trick and Divide and conquer dp?

This contest series is really helpful to learn DP. I've been doing some practice problems using this video as a reference. So far I've done the first five problems, and I already feel much more comfortable with DP! My procedure is as follows:
1. Start problem and solve as much as possible on my own.
2. Refer to Erichto description as necessary for some hints, if necessary (only if stuck for 1hr+)
3. Complete the problem
4. Finish watching Erichto solution to understand any missed opportunities or alternate solutions.
bluefog definitely knows it all

Hi, can you please teach me how to compile fast like to the min 11:00? It's a key combination? It's possible in vs code? Thanks

//errichto, I have a question with this:
#include<bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
int main(){
string s, t;
cin >> s >> t;
int ss = s.size(), ts = t.size();
vector<vector<pair<string,int> > > res (ss + 1, vector<pair<string, int> >(ts + 1, make_pair("", 0)));
for(int i = 1; i <= ss; i++){
for(int j = 1; j <=ts; j++){
if(s[i - 1] == t[j - 1]){
res[i][j].second = res[i-1][j-1].second + 1;
res[i][j].first = res[i-1][j-1].first + s[i-1];
}else{
if(res[i-1][j].second >= res[i][j-1].second){
res[i][j].second = res[i-1][j].second;
res[i][j].first = res[i-1][j].first;
}else{
res[i][j].second = res[i][j-1].second;
res[i][j].first = res[i][j-1].first;
}
}
}
}

cout << res[ss][ts].first << endl;

}
